items.title: Segway offers up to 50% savings on its Lumina and Cube power stations + accessories starting from $130
items.summary:
Segway is currently offering up to 50% savings on its power stations, like the latest Lumina 500 Portable Power Station at $179.99 shipped, which also matches its current Amazon pricing. While it carries a $400 MSRP direct from the brand, you can more often find it starting around $300, with the discounts we’ve seen on it going as low as $170 so far in its history. That means you’re getting the second-best rate with the deals here, saving you $120 ($220 off the MSRP) and giving you an ample, but compact, backup power companion for devices and small appliances. Below, you’ll also find the brand’s larger 1,024Wh and 2,048Wh models down at some of their best prices, too, along with accessories like expansion batteries and solar panels.

Down off its full $230 rate, we’ve seen discounts at Amazon take things as low as $160, which was last seen during Black Friday, while today’s rate last appeared during Christmas sales. You’re getting another shot at the third-best price we have tracked from Amazon here, giving you a significantly larger backup power companion for your personal devices with $59 cut from the going rate. You can also get some solid support with a bit more savings by going with its Prime 21,100mAh 3-Port 220W counterpart at $150 right now, too.

items.title: MCP unites Claude chat with apps like Slack, Figma, and Canva
items.summary: Anthropic's Claude got a bit livelier today thanks to a new extension to MCP, the open-source protocol that allows AI agents to easily access tools and data across the internet. Users will now be able to interact with apps directly inside the Claude chatbot, letting you draft and format Slack messages to colleagues and create […]

items.title: Now live again: Lenovo’s self-charging wireless keyboard is down to $61 (39% off)
items.summary:
Update: Lenovo’s self-charging keyboard in black has dropped back to $60.99 shipped after briefly returning to full price last week. More details in the original post below.

We just spotted a deal at Amazon that drops Lenovo’s self-charging full-size keyboard in black down to $60.99 shipped. This is regularly a $100 keyboard, which is currently fetching its full price directly at the brand’s online store. It briefly hit $60 earlier this month before selling out, and today’s deal lands it within just $1 of that price, making it a good time to cash in. You can also get this in white, although it’s currently sitting at $92.53 shipped with a relatively lighter deal. Head below for more details.

more…

items.title: Stack discounts and Baseus’ EnerFill 100W 3-port USB-C wall charger is yours for $22 (Save 56%)
items.summary:
Baseus EnerFill 100W 3-Port USB-C Wall Charger

Buy for $22 (Reg. $50)

Prime-exclusive discount. Apply code F7BPDQ7D during checkout.

What we love

Ready to power up to three devices at once or one at up to 100W, this handy little wall charger is worth a look. I love the compact design and that the AC prongs can be folded down when they are not in use.

items.title: Worx’s unique + safer 20V JawSaw cordless electric PowerShare chainsaw with retractable blade hits $132 (Reg. $170)
items.summary:
Over at Amazon, you can currently find the Worx 20V JawSaw Cordless Electric PowerShare Chainsaw with 2.0Ah battery at $132.22 shipped. Coming down from its full $170 rate, giving you a 22% markdown on a more unique and even safer outdoor cutting solution that protects you far more than traditional chainsaws, especially when using it directly on the ground. While we have seen it go lower in the past, today’s deal lands the price just $3 above its Black Friday rate, giving you a solid $38 savings in the process. You can find a number of the brand’s other lawn care tools at discounted rates in the official Amazon storefront here.

more…

Spigen has debuted a few new wall-mountable keychain holders over the last several months and the latest model has now dropped to a new $24.99 Prime shipped Amazon all-time low via its official storefront there.

items.title: Saudi satirist hacked with Pegasus spyware wins damages in court battle
items.summary: The London High Court awarded the London-based satirist and human rights activist Ghanem Al-Masarir more than £3 million, after finding the Saudi government hacked his phone and was likely behind a physical attack targeting him in London.

items.title: Bluetti’s Elite 10 Mini power station can accompany you anywhere and it’s now at a $113 Amazon low (Reg. $199)
items.summary:
Bluetti’s official Amazon storefront is offering personal device support in the form of its recently released Elite 10 Mini Portable Power Station at $113 shipped, beating out its current direct-website pricing by $6. This highly-compact model only hit the market in November with a $199 price tag, which has mostly been dropped to $139 or $119 with discounts, though there was a recent prime-exclusive period at this rate before it opened to everyone, as well as the one-time 48-hour $109 flash sale low from mid-December. Jumping on this deal today gives you $86 savings to the best Amazon price we have tracked, landing only $4 above the all-time low. You can also find several more of the brand’s power stations at discounted rates in the official Amazon storefront here.

more…
